013package org.apache.juneau.config;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.BinaryFormat.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.config.internal.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
029
030/**
031 * A single entry in a {@link Config} file.
032 */
033public class Entry {
034
035   private final ConfigMapEntry configEntry;
036   private final Config config;
037   private final String value;
038
039   /**
040    * Constructor.
041    *
042    * @param config The config that this entry belongs to.
043    * @param configMap The map that this belongs to.
044    * @param sectionName The section name of this entry.
045    * @param entryName The name of this entry.
046    */
047   protected Entry(Config config, ConfigMap configMap, String sectionName, String entryName) {
048      this.configEntry = configMap.getEntry(sectionName, entryName);
049      this.config = config;
050      this.value = configEntry == null ? null : config.removeMods(configEntry.getModifiers(), configEntry.getValue());
051   }
052
053   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
054   // Value retrievers
055   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
056
057   /**
058    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this entry exists in the config.
059    *
060    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this entry exists in the config.
061    */
062   public boolean isPresent() {
063      return ! isNull();
064   }
065
066   /**
067    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this entry exists in the config and is not empty.
068    *
069    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this entry exists in the config and is not empty.
070    */
071   public boolean isNotEmpty() {
072      return ! isEmpty();
073   }
074
075   /**
076    * Returns this entry as a string.
077    *
078    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this entry exists in the config and is not empty.
079    * @throws NullPointerException if value was <jk>null</jk>.
080    */
081   public String get() {
082      if (isNull())
083         throw new NullPointerException("Value was null");
084      return toString();
085   }
086
087   /**
088    * Returns this entry converted to the specified type or returns the default value.
089    *
090    * <p>
091    * This is equivalent to calling <c>as(<jv>def</jv>.getClass()).orElse(<jv>def</jv>)</c> but is simpler and
092    * avoids the creation of an {@link Optional} object.
093    *
094    * @param def The default value to return if value does not exist.
095    * @return This entry converted to the specified type or returns the default value.
096    */
097   public String orElse(String def) {
098      return isNull() ? def : get();
099   }
100
101   /**
102    * Returns this entry converted to the specified type or returns the default value.
103    *
104    * <p>
105    * This is equivalent to calling <c>as(<jv>def</jv>.getClass()).orElse(<jv>def</jv>)</c> but is simpler and
106    * avoids the creation of an {@link Optional} object.
107    *
108    * @param def The default value to return if value does not exist.
109    * @return This entry converted to the specified type or returns the default value.
110    */
111   public String orElseGet(Supplier<String> def) {
112      return isNull() ? def.get() : get();
113   }
114
115
116   /**
117    * Returns this entry converted to the specified type.
118    *
119    * @param <T> The type to convert the value to.
120    * @param type The type to convert the value to.
121    * @return This entry converted to the specified type.
122    */
123   public <T> Optional<T> as(Class<T> type) {
124      return as((Type)type);
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Returns this entry converted to the specified value.
129    *
130    * <p>
131    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
132    *
133    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
134    * <p class='bjava'>
135    *    Config <jv>config</jv> = Config.<jsm>create</jsm>().name(<js>"MyConfig.cfg"</js>).build();
136    *
137    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
138    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/myListOfStrings"</js>).to(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
139    *
140    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
141    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/myListOfBeans"</js>).to(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
142    *
143    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
144    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/my2dListOfStrings"</js>).to(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>,
145    *       LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
146    *
147    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
148    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/myMap"</js>).to(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>,
149    *       String.<jk>class</jk>);
150    *
151    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
152    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/myMapOfListsOfBeans"</js>).to(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>,
153    *       List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
154    * </p>
155    *
156    * <p>
157    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
158    *
159    * <p>
160    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value
161    * types.
162    *
163    * <p>
164    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
165    *
166    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
167    *    <li class='note'>
168    *       Use the {@link #as(Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
169    * </ul>
170    *
171    * @param <T> The object type to create.
172    * @param type
173    *    The object type to create.
174    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
175    * @param args
176    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
177    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
178    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
179    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the section or key does not exist.
180    */
181   public <T> Optional<T> as(Type type, Type...args) {
182      return as(config.parser, type, args);
183   }
184
185   /**
186    * Same as {@link #as(Type, Type...)} but specifies the parser to use to parse the entry.
187    *
188    * @param <T> The object type to create.
189    * @param parser
190    *    The parser to use to parse the entry.
191    * @param type
192    *    The object type to create.
193    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
194    * @param args
195    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
196    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
197    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
198    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the section or key does not exist.
199    */
200   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
201   public <T> Optional<T> as(Parser parser, Type type, Type...args) {
202      if (isNull())
203         return Utils.opte();
204
205      try {
206         var v = toString();
207         if (type == String.class) return (Optional<T>)asString();
208         if (type == String[].class) return (Optional<T>)asStringArray();
209         if (type == byte[].class) return (Optional<T>)asBytes();
210         if (type == int.class || type == Integer.class) return (Optional<T>)asInteger();
211         if (type == long.class || type == Long.class) return (Optional<T>)asLong();
212         if (type == JsonMap.class) return (Optional<T>)asMap();
213         if (type == JsonList.class) return (Optional<T>)asList();
214         if (isEmpty())
215            return Utils.opte();
216         if (isSimpleType(type))
217            return Utils.opt((T)config.beanSession.convertToType(v, (Class<?>)type));
218
219         if (parser instanceof JsonParser) {
220            var s1 = firstNonWhitespaceChar(v);
221            if (isArray(type) && s1 != '[')
222               v = '[' + v + ']';
223            else if (s1 != '[' && s1 != '{' && ! "null".equals(v))
224               v = '\'' + v + '\'';
225         }
226         return Utils.opt(parser.parse(v, type, args));
227      } catch (ParseException e) {
228         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, null, "Value could not be parsed.");
229      }
230   }
231
232   /**
233    * Returns this entry converted to the specified type.
234    *
235    * @param <T> The type to convert the value to.
236    * @param parser The parser to use to parse the entry value.
237    * @param type The type to convert the value to.
238    * @return This entry converted to the specified type, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the entry does not exist.
239    */
240   public <T> Optional<T> as(Parser parser, Class<T> type) {
241      return as(parser, (Type)type);
242   }
243
244   /**
245    * Returns this entry as a string.
246    *
247    * @return This entry as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the entry does not exist.
248    */
249   @Override
250   public String toString() {
251      return isPresent() ? config.varSession.resolve(value) : null;
252   }
253
254   /**
255    * Returns this entry as a string.
256    *
257    * @return This entry as a string, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the entry does not exist.
258    */
259   public Optional<String> asString() {
260      return Utils.opt(isPresent() ? config.varSession.resolve(value) : null);
261   }
262
263   /**
264    * Returns this entry as a string array.
265    *
266    * <p>
267    * If the value exists, splits the value on commas and returns the values as trimmed strings.
268    *
269    * @return This entry as a string array, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the entry does not exist.
270    */
271   public Optional<String[]> asStringArray() {
272      if (! isPresent())
273         return Utils.opte();
274      var v = toString();
275      var s1 = firstNonWhitespaceChar(v);
276      var s2 = lastNonWhitespaceChar(v);
277      if (s1 == '[' && s2 == ']' && config.parser instanceof JsonParser) {
278         try {
279            return Utils.opt(config.parser.parse(v, String[].class));
280         } catch (ParseException e) {
281            throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
282         }
283      }
284      return Utils.opt(splita(v));
285   }
286
287   /**
288    * Returns this entry as an integer.
289    *
290    * <p>
291    * <js>"K"</js>, <js>"M"</js>, and <js>"G"</js> can be used to identify kilo, mega, and giga in base 2.
292    * <br><js>"k"</js>, <js>"m"</js>, and <js>"g"</js> can be used to identify kilo, mega, and giga in base 10.
293    *
294    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
295    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
296    *    <li>
297    *       <code><js>"100K"</js> -&gt; 1024000</code>
298    *    <li>
299    *       <code><js>"100M"</js> -&gt; 104857600</code>
300    *    <li>
301    *       <code><js>"100k"</js> -&gt; 1000000</code>
302    *    <li>
303    *       <code><js>"100m"</js> -&gt; 100000000</code>
304    * </ul>
305    *
306    * <p>
307    * Uses {@link Integer#decode(String)} underneath, so any of the following integer formats are supported:
308    * <ul>
309    *    <li><js>"0x..."</js>
310    *    <li><js>"0X..."</js>
311    *    <li><js>"#..."</js>
312    *    <li><js>"0..."</js>
313    * </ul>
314    *
315    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the value does not exist or the value is empty.
316    */
317   public Optional<Integer> asInteger() {
318      return Utils.opt(isEmpty() ? null : (Integer)parseIntWithSuffix(toString()));
319   }
320
321
322   /**
323    * Returns this entry as a parsed boolean.
324    *
325    * <p>
326    * Uses {@link Boolean#parseBoolean(String)} to parse value.
327    *
328    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the value does not exist or the value is empty.
329    */
330   public Optional<Boolean> asBoolean() {
331      return Utils.opt(isEmpty() ? null : (Boolean)Boolean.parseBoolean(toString()));
332   }
333
334   /**
335    * Returns this entry as a long.
336    *
337    * <p>
338    * <js>"K"</js>, <js>"M"</js>, <js>"G"</js>, <js>"T"</js>, and <js>"P"</js> can be used to identify kilo, mega, giga, tera, and penta in base 2.
339    * <br><js>"k"</js>, <js>"m"</js>, <js>"g"</js>, <js>"t"</js>, and <js>"p"</js> can be used to identify kilo, mega, giga, tera, and p in base 10.
340    *
341    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
342    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
343    *    <li>
344    *       <code><js>"100K"</js> -&gt; 1024000</code>
345    *    <li>
346    *       <code><js>"100M"</js> -&gt; 104857600</code>
347    *    <li>
348    *       <code><js>"100k"</js> -&gt; 1000000</code>
349    *    <li>
350    *       <code><js>"100m"</js> -&gt; 100000000</code>
351    * </ul>
352    *
353    * <p>
354    * Uses {@link Long#decode(String)} underneath, so any of the following integer formats are supported:
355    * <ul>
356    *    <li><js>"0x..."</js>
357    *    <li><js>"0X..."</js>
358    *    <li><js>"#..."</js>
359    *    <li><js>"0..."</js>
360    * </ul>
361    *
362    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the value does not exist or the value is empty.
363    */
364   public Optional<Long> asLong() {
365      return Utils.opt(isEmpty() ? null : (Long)parseLongWithSuffix(toString()));
366   }
367
368   /**
369    * Returns this entry as a double.
370    *
371    * <p>
372    * Uses {@link Double#valueOf(String)} underneath, so any of the following number formats are supported:
373    * <ul>
374    *    <li><js>"0x..."</js>
375    *    <li><js>"0X..."</js>
376    *    <li><js>"#..."</js>
377    *    <li><js>"0..."</js>
378    * </ul>
379    *
380    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the value does not exist or the value is empty.
381    */
382   public Optional<Double> asDouble() {
383      return Utils.opt(isEmpty() ? null : Double.valueOf(toString()));
384   }
385
386   /**
387    * Returns this entry as a float.
388    *
389    * <p>
390    * Uses {@link Float#valueOf(String)} underneath, so any of the following number formats are supported:
391    * <ul>
392    *    <li><js>"0x..."</js>
393    *    <li><js>"0X..."</js>
394    *    <li><js>"#..."</js>
395    *    <li><js>"0..."</js>
396    * </ul>
397    *
398    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the value does not exist or the value is empty.
399    */
400   public Optional<Float> asFloat() {
401      return Utils.opt(isEmpty() ? null : Float.valueOf(toString()));
402   }
403
404   /**
405    * Returns this entry as a byte array.
406    *
407    * <p>
408    * Byte arrays are stored as encoded strings, typically BASE64, but dependent on the {@link Config.Builder#binaryFormat(BinaryFormat)} setting.
409    *
410    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the section or key does not exist.
411    */
412   public Optional<byte[]> asBytes() {
413      if (isNull())
414         return Utils.opte();
415      var s = toString();
416      if (s.indexOf('\n') != -1)
417         s = s.replace("\n", "");
418      try {
419         if (config.binaryFormat == HEX)
420            return Utils.opt(fromHex(s));
421         if (config.binaryFormat == SPACED_HEX)
422            return Utils.opt(fromSpacedHex(s));
423         return Utils.opt(base64Decode(s));
424      } catch (Exception e) {
425         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, null, "Value could not be converted to a byte array.");
426      }
427   }
428
429   /**
430    * Returns this entry as a parsed map.
431    *
432    * <p>
433    * Uses the parser registered on the {@link Config} to parse the entry.
434    *
435    * <p>
436    * If the parser is a JSON parser, the starting/trailing <js>"{"</js>/<js>"}"</js> in the value are optional.
437    *
438    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the section or key does not exist.
439    * @throws ParseException If value could not be parsed.
440    */
441   public Optional<JsonMap> asMap() throws ParseException {
442      return asMap(config.parser);
443   }
444
445   /**
446    * Returns this entry as a parsed map.
447    *
448    * <p>
449    * If the parser is a JSON parser, the starting/trailing <js>"{"</js>/<js>"}"</js> in the value are optional.
450    *
451    * @param parser The parser to use to parse the value, or {@link Optional#empty()} to use the parser defined on the config.
452    * @return The value, or <jk>null</jk> if the section or key does not exist.
453    * @throws ParseException If value could not be parsed.
454    */
455   public Optional<JsonMap> asMap(Parser parser) throws ParseException {
456      if (isNull())
457         return Utils.opte();
458      if (parser == null)
459         parser = config.parser;
460      var s = toString();
461      if (parser instanceof JsonParser) {
462         var s1 = firstNonWhitespaceChar(s);
463         if (s1 != '{' && ! "null".equals(s))
464            s = '{' + s + '}';
465      }
466      return Utils.opt(JsonMap.ofText(s, parser));
467   }
468
469   /**
470    * Returns this entry as a parsed list.
471    *
472    * <p>
473    * Uses the parser registered on the {@link Config} to parse the entry.
474    *
475    * <p>
476    * If the parser is a JSON parser, the starting/trailing <js>"["</js>/<js>"]"</js> in the value are optional.
477    *
478    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the section or key does not exist.
479    * @throws ParseException If value could not be parsed.
480    */
481   public Optional<JsonList> asList() throws ParseException {
482      return asList(config.parser);
483   }
484
485   /**
486    * Returns this entry as a parsed list.
487    *
488    * <p>
489    * If the parser is a JSON parser, the starting/trailing <js>"["</js>/<js>"]"</js> in the value are optional.
490    *
491    * @param parser The parser to use to parse the value, or {@link Optional#empty()} to use the parser defined on the config.
492    * @return The value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the section or key does not exist.
493    * @throws ParseException If value could not be parsed.
494    */
495   public Optional<JsonList> asList(Parser parser) throws ParseException {
496      if (isNull())
497         return Utils.opte();
498      if (parser == null)
499         parser = config.parser;
500      var s = toString();
501      if (parser instanceof JsonParser) {
502         var s1 = firstNonWhitespaceChar(s);
503         if (s1 != '[' && ! "null".equals(s))
504            s = '[' + s + ']';
505      }
506      return Utils.opt(JsonList.ofText(s, parser));
507   }
508
509   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
510   // Metadata retrievers
511   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
512
513   /**
514    * Returns the name of this entry.
515    *
516    * @return The name of this entry.
517    */
518   public String getKey() {
519      return configEntry.getKey();
520   }
521
522   /**
523    * Returns the raw value of this entry.
524    *
525    * @return The raw value of this entry.
526    */
527   public String getValue() {
528      return configEntry.getValue();
529   }
530
531   /**
532    * Returns the same-line comment of this entry.
533    *
534    * @return The same-line comment of this entry.
535    */
536   public String getComment() {
537      return configEntry.getComment();
538   }
539
540   /**
541    * Returns the pre-lines of this entry.
542    *
543    * @return The pre-lines of this entry as an unmodifiable list.
544    */
545   public List<String> getPreLines() {
546      return configEntry.getPreLines();
547   }
548
549   /**
550    * Returns the modifiers for this entry.
551    *
552    * @return The modifiers for this entry, or <jk>null</jk> if it has no modifiers.
553    */
554   public String getModifiers() {
555      return configEntry.getModifiers();
556   }
557
558   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
559   // Helper methods
560   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
561
562   private boolean isEmpty() {
563      return Utils.isEmpty(value);
564   }
565
566   private boolean isNull() {
567      return value == null;
568   }
569
570   private boolean isArray(Type t) {
571      if (! (t instanceof Class))
572         return false;
573      var c = (Class<?>)t;
574      return (c.isArray());
575   }
576
577   private boolean isSimpleType(Type t) {
578      if (! (t instanceof Class))
579         return false;
580      var c = (Class<?>)t;
581      return (c == String.class || c.isPrimitive() || c.isAssignableFrom(Number.class) || c == Boolean.class || c.isEnum());
582   }
583}
